file_content.text: And you return alive. Have you heard? The Exchange and Stardogs have blamed one another for their negotiators' deaths.
They have started a limited war. The truth, as they say, was the first casualty.
Now... I believe you have a dossier for me.
I looked. Half of the names I've never heard of.
It's not that impressive.
Yes, but if we can find these rising stars, they will soon be extinguished.
An alliance with the Stardogs' purpose and the Exchange's assassins would have been dangerous indeed.
When I give my word, I mean it.
I keep my promises.
Loyalty like yours is why alliances fail and empires prevail.
Your success will allow us to find and destroy the Exchange's enforcers. Everyone here owes their safety to you.
Here.
You don't savor your victories? Pity.
On Nar Shaddaa, small satisfactions are a valuable currency.
The more usual currency, however, is plentiful. Here--this payment is yours for dividing those who would harm us.
In fact, a Republic-aligned group of war veterans called the Stardogs are preparing to strike at you.
"Stardogs"? I've never heard of them.
Who?
They are Corellians and sympathizers to the Republic. They hate our Empire and smuggle weapons to our enemies.
Are you sure?
I am not prone to exaggeration. Their anti-Imperial sentiment is focused on you like a laser.
Let them come. I'm responsible for more bodies than a Coruscant cemetery.
Then they'll die.
I don't doubt it, but the Stardogs are not raw recruits.
Being Republic, they have a certain distaste for direct assassination jobs.
But they're alarmed and contracting with the Nar Shaddaa Exchange to have you killed.
Many have tried. Many more will.
I can handle them.
I thought you might have that attitude.
They fear me, and that is why they will lose.
I can handle them.
Someone should tell those Republic sympathizers that it's really nothing personal.
I'm not an Imperial.
The Empire has employed you often. For them, it is connection enough.
If you could learn all this, they're hardly professionals.
I'm not impressed.
I have sources whose lives depend on me. I would not underestimate your opponents.
Life's interesting that way.
Confidence is good, but there's no reason to fight at the time and place they choose.
One of these days, I'm going to fake my death just to cash in.
Hazard of the job.
Forgive me if I don't find that humorous. After you, the people in this building are next.
I ask, while you are there, to take the Exchange's dossier on their hit men. Can you do this?
I like assassinating assassins. They always look so surprised.
I'll kill them all.
Then you will enjoy this.
Done.
I agree.
This is too convenient to be believed.
Too easy. [Refuse quest]
Wait, then. Lower your guard and see what occurs.
I have something better. I have their location.
Exchange negotiators are meeting with the Stardogs in the Corellian Sector as we speak. It is in your interest, of course, to kill them.
You've arrived at last.
Your arrival on this planet has not gone unnoticed, by the Empire or otherwise.
Welcome to our operation, bounty hunter. You will find yourself busy here.
Welcome to our operation, my lord.
Welcome to our operation. It is good to see you together, now that our enemies are linking your activities.
The Exchange and Stardogs are negotiating again, but their hearts are still at war.
I wouldn't stand still if I were you.
As you see, our presence on this planet is not so open as on others.
To the Corellian Sector, then. With that data, we shall soon have all of these beasts in one slaughterhouse.
Stardogs + Exchange = neutralized // Colonel Siturn + B9 = grateful for assistance
B9 = monitored meeting location + detected no survivors // Mission success = alert Colonel Siturn
B9 = initiating dossier analysis // Serving with you = B9's honor
Stardogs + Exchange = threat to the Empire // B9 = suggests haste
Imperial squad = halt for identification // B9 = analyzing... success! // Squad = responsible for many victories
B9 = apologizes for interruption // B9 = unworthy of Sith master // Sith master = in danger of termination
Mercenary = halt for identification // B9 = analyzing... success! // Mercenary = wanted by the Republic
Agent = identification in progress // Agent = identified as Cipher Nine // B9 = welcomes Imperial Intelligence
B9 + Colonel Siturn = briefing you on threat // Republic = monitoring your activities + taking action
Stardogs + Exchange = meeting to discuss contract details // Meeting = optimal conditions for Imperial counterattack
Stardog mission success = report to B9 // Stardog mission failure = termination
Stardogs + Exchange = termination // Inaction = does not compute
B9 = important Imperial liaison // Current inquiry = will be ignored
